ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In Professor Marcus's course, I learned how to approach the complexity of the Decameron through a close reading and in-depth discussion of each of its Days. The course emphasized various types of narrative types within the frame story; this provided an incredible introduction to medieval literature more broadly. Having studied Dante previously, it was really incredible to compare Boccaccio's interventions in prose. Moreover, thinking through Professor Marcus's discussion topics provided a concrete methodology to understand the text and to make connections between this work and other literary and visual output of the period.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I felt the course was really well organized and coherent. Each discussion provided new revelations! I have no suggestions for improvement.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to anyone interested in medieval literature. Professor Marcus is incredibly passionate about the material and is full of insights. Reading the Decameron with her has been an unforgettable experience!
